item.title: Is granting AIs legal freedoms one way to approach alignment issues?
item.description:
Matthew Barnett (@MatthewJBar) on X

The thesis of this paper seems well-aligned with how I think about AI governance. I’m glad to see people taking seriously the idea that good AI policy will likely involve granting AIs legal freedoms, rather than purely focusing on control measures. https://t.co/RIkCN6CtWu

URL: https://x.com/MatthewJBar/status/1819574092460445730

item.title: Joe Weisenthal (@TheStalwart) on X
item.description:
Joe Weisenthal (@TheStalwart) on X

Folks, I really think if you’re still sleeping on prediction markets, it’s time to reassess your priors and look at what’s going on. This site alone I was just looking shows tens of billions of dollars being bet on whether the Fed is going to cut rates in September.

URL: https://twitter.com/TheStalwart/status/1819034768081662208

item.title: Rex “garbage in” Douglass Ph.D. (@RexDouglass) on X
item.description:
Rex “garbage in” Douglass Ph.D. (@RexDouglass) on X

IV papers are pretty much all mining noise for stars. Delete one observation and 37% become insig. Delete 2 and 57% become insig. Concerns about generalizing to the real world are overblown, most results don’t even generalize to their sample. https://t.co/UxeitgBxqg

URL: https://twitter.com/RexDouglass/status/1819027285896478895

source: Best of Twitter July 29 - August 4, 2024

The fact that South Koreans allegedly have the highest IQ out of all East Asians (elite magnet city states aside) and the only Nobel prize they’ve got is the Peace one, same as Palestine and Congo, must give pause to all IQ enjoyers who say culture doesn’t matter. Oh, it does.
